junit@yahoogroups.com wrote:

> Whether the "fileset" task includes a class=
 specifically or via
> wildcard, JUnit will instantiate a TestSuite, reflec=
tively find all
> methods in a class that begin with "test", and then attem=
pt to execute
> them.  In our cases, there are a number of existing methods=
 which
> begin with "test" but are protected and thus do not get executed. =

> However, this leads to test method failures.  Now, I could rename
> thes=
e methods to avoid the errors, but I am hoping to find a way
> around it so=
 that developers in the future could add methods to
> future test classes w=
ithout having to worry about not naming them
> test*. 

These are the lines=
 in junits TestSuite causing the problem: 

		if (! isPublicTestMethod(m)) =
{
			if (isTestMethod(m))
				addTest(warning("Test method isn't public:
"+=
m.getName()));
			return;
		}

Does anyone actually *want* that behaviour??=
? I wouldn't mind if the warning
simply would be removed.

(BTW, you can wo=
rk around this behavior by adding a dummy argument to the
method. Not very =
elegant, I know...)

Cheers, Ilja
